intro: [WRONG START] Liatris ohlingeraa, commonly known as Ohling's blazing star, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Texas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features tall, sparsely leafed stems that bear showy, pinkish-purple flower clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in prairie and open woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species requiring conservation efforts.
